   22: 
   23: -module(ssh_protocol_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet.hrl").
   27: -include("ssh.hrl").		% ?UINT32, ?BYTE, #ssh{} ...
   28: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   29: -include("ssh_auth.hrl").
   30: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([
   33:          suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          groups/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:          init_per_testcase/2,
   39:          end_per_testcase/2
   40:         ]).
   41: 
   42: -export([
   43:          bad_long_service_name/1,
   44:          bad_packet_length/2,
   45:          bad_service_name/1,
   46:          bad_service_name/2,
   47:          bad_service_name_length/2,
   48:          bad_service_name_then_correct/1,
   49:          bad_very_long_service_name/1,
   50:          client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds/1,
   51:          client_info_line/1,
   52:          do_gex_client_init/3,
   53:          do_gex_client_init_old/3,
   54:          empty_service_name/1,
   55:          ext_info_c/1,
   56:          ext_info_s/1,
   57:          kex_strict_negotiated/1,
   58:          kex_strict_msg_ignore/1,
   59:          kex_strict_msg_unknown/1,
   60:          gex_client_init_option_groups/1,
   61:          gex_client_init_option_groups_file/1,
   62:          gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file/1,
   63:          gex_client_old_request_exact/1,
   64:          gex_client_old_request_noexact/1,
   65:          gex_server_gex_limit/1,
   66:          lib_match/1,
   67:          lib_no_match/1,
   68:          lib_works_as_client/1,
   69:          lib_works_as_server/1,
   70:          modify_append/1,
   71:          modify_combo/1,
   72:          modify_prepend/1,
   73:          modify_rm/1,
   74:          no_common_alg_client_disconnects/1,
   75:          no_common_alg_server_disconnects/1,
   76:          no_ext_info_s1/1,
   77:          no_ext_info_s2/1,
   78:          packet_length_too_large/1,
   79:          packet_length_too_short/1,
   80:          preferred_algorithms/1,
   81:          service_name_length_too_large/1,
   82:          service_name_length_too_short/1,
   83:          client_close_after_hello/1
   84:         ]).
   85: 
   86: -define(NEWLINE, <<"\r\n">>).
   87: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   88: 
   89: -define(DEFAULT_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group14-sha256').
   90: -define(EXTRA_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group1-sha1').
   91: 
   92: -define(CIPHERS, ['aes256-ctr','aes192-ctr','aes128-ctr','aes128-cbc','3des-cbc']).
   93: -define(DEFAULT_CIPHERS, (fun() -> Ciphs = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
   94:                                    [{client2server,Ciphs}, {server2client,Ciphs}]
   95:                           end)()
   96:         ).
   97: 
   98: 
   99: -define(v(Key, Config), proplists:get_value(Key, Config)).
  100: -define(v(Key, Config, Default), proplists:get_value(Key, Config, Default)).
  101: 
  102: 
  103: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  104: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  105: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  106: 
  107: suite() ->
  108:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  109:      {timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  110: 
  111: all() -> 
  112:     [{group,tool_tests},
  113:      client_info_line,
  114:      {group,kex},
  115:      {group,service_requests},
  116:      {group,authentication},
  117:      {group,packet_size_error},
  118:      {group,field_size_error},
  119:      {group,ext_info},
  120:      {group,preferred_algorithms},
  121:      {group,client_close_early}
  122:     ].
  123: 
  124: groups() ->
  125:     [{tool_tests, [], [lib_works_as_client,
  126: 		       lib_works_as_server,
  127: 		       lib_match,
  128: 		       lib_no_match
  129: 		      ]},
  130:      {packet_size_error, [], [packet_length_too_large,
  131: 			      packet_length_too_short]},
  132:       
  133:      {field_size_error, [], [service_name_length_too_large,
  134: 			     service_name_length_too_short]},
  135:       
  136:      {kex, [], [no_common_alg_server_disconnects,
  137: 		no_common_alg_client_disconnects,
  138: 		gex_client_init_option_groups,
  139: 		gex_server_gex_limit,
  140: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file,
  141: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_file,
  142: 		gex_client_old_request_exact,
  143: 		gex_client_old_request_noexact,
  144:                 kex_strict_negotiated,
  145:                 kex_strict_msg_ignore,
  146:                 kex_strict_msg_unknown]},
  147:      {service_requests, [], [bad_service_name,
  148: 			     bad_long_service_name,
  149: 			     bad_very_long_service_name,
  150: 			     empty_service_name,
  151: 			     bad_service_name_then_correct
  152: 			    ]},
  153:      {authentication, [], [client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds
  154: 			  ]},
  155:      {ext_info, [], [no_ext_info_s1,
  156:                      no_ext_info_s2,
  157:                      ext_info_s,
  158:                      ext_info_c
  159:                     ]},
  160:      {preferred_algorithms, [], [preferred_algorithms,
  161:                                  modify_append,
  162:                                  modify_prepend,
  163:                                  modify_rm,
  164:                                  modify_combo
  165:                                 ]},
  166:      {client_close_early, [], [client_close_after_hello
  167:                                ]}
  168:     ].
  169: 
  170: 
  171: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  172:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(start_std_daemon( setup_dirs( start_apps(Config)))).
  173: 
  174: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  175:     stop_apps(Config).
  176: 
  177: init_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  178:     start_std_daemon(Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']},
  179:                                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  180:                                                     ]}]);
  181: init_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  182:     Config;
  183: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  184: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  185: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  186: 				   TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  187: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  188: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  189:     Opts = case TC of
  190: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups ->
  191: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, 
  192:                      [{1023, 5, 
  193:                        16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F
  194:                       }]}];
  195: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_file ->
  196: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  197: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test"),
  198: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {file,F}}];
  199: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ->
  200: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  201: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test.moduli"),
  202: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {ssh_moduli_file,F}}];
  203: 	       _ when TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  204: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  205: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  206: 		    [{dh_gex_groups, 
  207:                       [{1023, 2, 16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A771225323},
  208:                        {1535, 5, 16#D1391174233D315398FE2830AC6B2B66BCCD01B0A634899F339B7879F1DB85712E9DC4E4B1C6C8355570C1D2DCB53493DF18175A9C53D1128B592B4C72D97136F5542FEB981CBFE8012FDD30361F288A42BD5EBB08BAB0A5640E1AC48763B2ABD1945FEE36B2D55E1D50A1C86CED9DD141C4E7BE2D32D9B562A0F8E2E927020E91F58B57EB9ACDDA106A59302D7E92AD5F6E851A45FA1CFE86029A0F727F65A8F475F33572E2FDAB6073F0C21B8B54C3823DB2EF068927E5D747498F96E1E827},
  209:                        {3071, 2, 16#DFAA35D35531E0F524F0099877A482D2AC8D589F374394A262A8E81A8A4FB2F65FADBAB395E05D147B29D486DFAA41F41597A256DA82A8B6F76401AED53D0253F956CEC610D417E42E3B287F7938FC24D8821B40BFA218A956EB7401BED6C96C68C7FD64F8170A8A76B953DD2F05420118F6B144D8FE48060A2BCB85056B478EDEF96DBC70427053ECD2958C074169E9550DD877779A3CF17C5AC850598C7586BEEA9DCFE9DD2A5FB62DF5F33EA7BC00CDA31B9D2DD721F979EA85B6E63F0C4E30BDDCD3A335522F9004C4ED50B15DC537F55324DD4FA119FB3F101467C6D7E1699DE4B3E3C478A8679B8EB3FA5C9B826B44530FD3BE9AD3063B240B0C853EBDDBD68DD940332D98F148D5D9E1DC977D60A0D23D0CA1198637FEAE4E7FAAC173AF2B84313A666CFB4EE6972811921D0AD867CE57F3BBC8D6CB057E3B66757BB46C9F72662624D44E14528327E3A7100E81A12C43C4E236118318CD90C8AA185BBB0C764826DAEAEE8DD245C5B451B4944E6122CC522D1C335C2EEF9429825A2B}
  210:                       ]},
  211:                      {dh_gex_limits, {1023,2000}}
  212: 		    ];
  213: 	       _ ->
  214: 		   []
  215: 	   end,
  216:     start_std_daemon(Config,
  217: 		     [{preferred_algorithms,[{cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  218:                                             ]}
  219: 		      | Opts]);
  220: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  221:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  222: 
  223: end_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  224:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  225: end_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  226:     Config;
  227: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  228: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  229: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  230: 				  TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  231: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  232: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  233:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  234: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  235:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  236: 
  237: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  238: %%% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  239: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  240: 
  241: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: %%% Connect to an erlang server and check that the testlib acts as a client.
  243: lib_works_as_client(Config) ->
  244:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  245:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  246: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  247: 			 ),
  248:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState),
  249: 
  250:     %% Do the authentcation
  251:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  252:     {ok,EndState} =
  253: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  254: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  255: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  256: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
  257: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
  258: 					    method = "password",
  259: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
  260: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
  261: 					   }},
  262: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  263: 	  ], AfterKexState),
  264: 
  265:     %% Disconnect
  266:     {ok,_} =
  267: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  268: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
  269: 				      description = "End of the fun",
  270: 				      language = ""
  271: 				     }},
  272: 	   close_socket
  273: 	  ], EndState).
  274: 
  275: 
  276: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  277: %%% Connect an erlang client and check that the testlib can act as a server.
  278: lib_works_as_server(Config) ->
  279:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  280: 
  281:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  282:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  283:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  284: 
  285:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  286:     spawn_link(
  287:       fun() ->
  288: 	      {ok,_} =
  289: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  290: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  291: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  292: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  293: 		     receive_hello,
  294: 		     {send, hello},
  295: 
  296: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  297: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  298: 
  299: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  300: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  301: 
  302: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  303: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  304: 
  305: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  306: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  307: 
  308: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  309: 						       method="none",
  310: 						       user=User,
  311: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  312: 
  313: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "password",
  314: 						      partial_success = false}},
  315: 
  316: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  317: 						       method="password",
  318: 						       user=User,
  319: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  320: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  321: 		     close_socket,
  322: 		     print_state
  323: 		    ],
  324: 		    InitialState)
  325:       end),
  326: 
  327:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  328:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  329: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  330:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  331:                                                 ]}
  332:                          ]
  333: 			).
  334: 
  335: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  336: %%% Matching
  337: lib_match(_Config) ->
  338:     {ok,_} =
  339: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  340: 				{match, abc, abc},
  341: 				{match, '$a', {cde,fgh}},
  342: 				{match, {cde,fgh}, '$a'},
  343: 				{match, '_', {cde,fgh}},
  344: 				{match, [a,'$a',b], [a,{cde,fgh},b]},
  345: 				{match, [a,'$a'|'$b'], [a,{cde,fgh},b,c]},
  346: 				{match, '$b', [b,c]}
  347: 			       ]).
  348: 
  349: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  350: %%% Not matching
  351: lib_no_match(_Config) ->
  352:     case ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  353: 				 {match, '$x', b},
  354: 				 {match, a, '$x'}])
  355:     of
  356: 	{ok,_} -> {fail,"Unexpected match"};
  357: 	{error, {_Op,{expected,a,b},_State}} -> ok
  358:     end.
  359: 
  360: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  361: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  362: %%% being sent from the server.
  363: no_common_alg_server_disconnects(Config) ->
  364:     {ok,_} =
  365: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  366: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  367: 	   {connect,
  368: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  369: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  370: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  371: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  372: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  373:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  374:                                    ]}
  375: 	    ]},
  376: 	   receive_hello,
  377: 	   {send, hello},
  378: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  379: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},  % with server unsupported 'ssh-dss' !
  380: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  381: 	  ]
  382: 	 ).
  383: 
  384: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  385: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  386: %%% being sent from the client.
  387: no_common_alg_client_disconnects(Config) ->
  388:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  389:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  390:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  391:     Parent = self(),
  392: 
  393:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  394:     Pid =
  395: 	spawn_link(
  396: 	  fun() ->
  397: 		  Parent !
  398: 		      {result,self(),
  399: 		       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  400: 			 [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  401: 			  {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  402: 				    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  403: 			  receive_hello,
  404: 			  {send, hello},
  405: 			  {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  406: 			  {send,  #ssh_msg_kexinit{ % with unsupported "SOME-UNSUPPORTED"
  407: 				     cookie = <<80,158,95,51,174,35,73,130,246,141,200,49,180,190,82,234>>,
  408: 				     kex_algorithms = [atom_to_list(?DEFAULT_KEX)],
  409: 				     server_host_key_algorithms = ["SOME-UNSUPPORTED"],  % SIC!
  410: 				     encryption_algorithms_client_to_server = ["aes128-ctr"],
  411: 				     encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = ["aes128-ctr"],
  412: 				     mac_algorithms_client_to_server = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  413: 				     mac_algorithms_server_to_client = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  414: 				     compression_algorithms_client_to_server = ["none"],
  415: 				     compression_algorithms_server_to_client = ["none"],
  416: 				     languages_client_to_server = [],
  417: 				     languages_server_to_client = [],
  418: 				     first_kex_packet_follows = false,
  419: 				     reserved = 0
  420: 				    }},
  421: 			  {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}
  422: 			 ],
  423: 			 InitialState)
  424: 		      }
  425: 	  end),
  426: 
  427:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  428:     %% which of course does not support SOME-UNSUPPORTED as pub key algo:
  429:     Result = std_connect(HostPort, Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  430:                                                                    {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  431:                                                                   ]}]),
  432:     ct:log("Result of connect is ~p",[Result]),
  433: 
  434:     receive
  435: 	{result,Pid,{ok,_}} -> 
  436: 	    ok;
  437: 	{result,Pid,{error,{Op,ExecResult,S}}} ->
  438: 	    ct:log("ERROR!~nOp = ~p~nExecResult = ~p~nState =~n~s",
  439: 		   [Op,ExecResult,ssh_trpt_test_lib:format_msg(S)]),
  440: 	    {fail, ExecResult};
  441: 	X -> 
  442: 	    ct:log("¤¤¤¤¤"),
  443: 	    ct:fail(X)
  444:     after 
  445: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  446:     end.
  447: 
  448: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  449: gex_client_init_option_groups(Config) ->
  450:     do_gex_client_init(Config, {512, 2048, 4000},

  471: do_gex_client_init(Config, {Min,N,Max}, {G,P}) ->
  472:     {ok,_} =
  473: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  474: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  475: 	   {connect,
  476: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  477: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  478: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  479: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  480: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  481:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  482:                                    ]}
  483: 	    ]},
  484: 	   receive_hello,
  485: 	   {send, hello},
  486: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  487: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  488: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request{min = Min, 
  489: 					      n = N,
  490: 					      max = Max}},
  491: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_group{p=P, g=G, _='_'},  receive_msg}
  492: 	  ]
  493: 	 ).
  494:

  499:                            ).

  504:                            ).

  517:                                    ]}
  518: 	    ]},

  528: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  529: bad_service_name(Config) -> 
  530:     bad_service_name(Config, "kfglkjf").
  531:     
  532: bad_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  533:     bad_service_name(Config, 
  534: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE div 2, $a)).
  535: 
  536: bad_very_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  537:     bad_service_name(Config,
  538: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE+5, $a)).
  539: 
  540: empty_service_name(Config) ->
  541:     bad_service_name(Config, "").
  542:     
  543: bad_service_name_then_correct(Config) ->
  544:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  545:     {ok,_} =
  546: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  547: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  548: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "kdjglkfdjgkldfjglkdfjglkfdjglkj"}},
  549: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-connection"}},
  550: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  551: 	   ], InitialState).
  552: 
  553: 
  554: bad_service_name(Config, Name) ->
  555:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  556:     {ok,_} =
  557: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  558: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  559: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = Name}},
  560: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  561: 	  ], InitialState).
  562: 
  563: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  564: packet_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, +4).
  565: 
  566: packet_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, -4).
  567:     
  568: bad_packet_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  569:     PacketFun = 
  570: 	fun(Msg, Ssh) ->
  571: 		BinMsg = ssh_message:encode(Msg),
  572: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh, LengthExcess)
  573: 	end,
  574:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  575:     {ok,_} =
  576: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  577: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  578: 	   {send, {special,
  579: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"},
  580: 		   PacketFun}},
  581: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  582: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  583: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  584: 	  ], InitialState).
  585: 
  586: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  587: service_name_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, +4).
  588: 
  589: service_name_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, -4).
  590: 
  591: 
  592: bad_service_name_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  593:     PacketFun = 
  594: 	fun(#ssh_msg_service_request{name=Service}, Ssh) ->
  595: 		BinName = list_to_binary(Service),
  596: 		BinMsg = 
  597: 		    <<?BYTE(?SSH_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST),
  598: 		      %% A bad string encoding of Service:
  599: 		      ?UINT32(size(BinName)+LengthExcess), BinName/binary
  600: 		    >>,
  601: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh)
  602: 	end,
  603:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  604:     {ok,_} =
  605: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  606: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  607: 	   {send, {special,
  608: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, 
  609: 		   PacketFun} },
  610: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  611: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  612: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  613: 	  ], InitialState).
  614:     
  615: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  616: %%% This is due to a fault report (OTP-13255) with OpenSSH-6.6.1
  617: client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds(Config) ->
  618:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  619: 
  620:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  621:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  622:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  623: 
  624:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  625:     spawn_link(
  626:       fun() ->
  627: 	      {ok,_} =
  628: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  629: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  630: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  631: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  632: 		     receive_hello,
  633: 		     {send, hello},
  634: 
  635: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  636: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  637: 
  638: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  639: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  640: 
  641: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  642: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  643: 
  644: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  645: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  646: 
  647: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  648: 						       method="none",
  649: 						       user=User,
  650: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  651: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  652: 						      partial_success = false}},
  653: 		     
  654: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  655: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  656: 						       user=User,
  657: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  658: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  659: 							   instruction = "",
  660: 							   language_tag = "",
  661: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  662: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  663: 							  }},
  664: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  665: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  666: 		      
  667: 		     %% the next is strange, but openssh 6.6.1 does this and this is what this testcase is about
  668: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  669: 							   instruction = "",
  670: 							   language_tag = "",
  671: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  672: 							   data = <<>>
  673: 							  }},
  674: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  675: 							     data = <<>>,
  676: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  677: 		     %% Here we know that the tested fault is fixed
  678: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  679: 		     close_socket,
  680: 		     print_state
  681: 		    ],
  682: 		    InitialState)
  683:       end),
  684: 
  685:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  686:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  687: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  688:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  689:                                                 ]}]
  690: 			).
  691: 
  692: 
  693: 
  694: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  695: client_info_line(Config) ->
  696:     %% A client must not send an info-line. If it does, the server should handle
  697:     %% handle this gracefully
  698:     {ok,Pid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
  699:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  700:     {_, _, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir,DataDir}]),
  701: 
  702:     %% Fake client:
  703:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost",Port,[]),
  704:     gen_tcp:send(S,"An illegal info-string\r\n"),
  705:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  706: 
  707:     %% wait for server to react:
  708:     timer:sleep(1000),
  709: 
  710:     %% check if a badmatch was received:
  711:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(Pid),
  712:     case lists:any(fun({error_report,_,{_,supervisor_report,L}}) when is_list(L) -> 
  713: 			   lists:member({reason,{badmatch,{error,closed}}}, L);
  714: 		      (_) ->
  715: 			   false
  716: 		   end, Reports) of
  717: 	true ->
  718: 	    ct:fail("Bad error report on info_line from client");
  719: 	false ->
  720: 	    ok
  721:     end.
  722: 	
  723: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  724: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  725: %%% the client does not tell the server to send it
  726: no_ext_info_s1(Config) ->
  727:     %% Start the daemon
  728:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  729:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  730:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{server,Server}|Config]),
  731:     {ok,_} = 
  732:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  733:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  734: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  735:           ], AfterKexState),
  736:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  737: 
  738: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  739: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  740: %%% the server is not configured to send it
  741: no_ext_info_s2(Config) ->    
  742:     %% Start the daemon
  743:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,false},
  744:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  745:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  746:                                           {server,Server}
  747:                                           | Config]),
  748:     {ok,_} =
  749:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  750:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  751: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  752:           ], AfterKexState),
  753:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  754: 
  755: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  756: %%% The server sends the extension
  757: ext_info_s(Config) ->    
  758:     %% Start the daemon
  759:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  760:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  761:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  762:                                           {server,Server}
  763:                                           | Config]),
  764:     {ok,_} =
  765:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  766:           [{match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  767:           ],
  768:           AfterKexState),
  769:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  770: 
  771: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  772: %%% The client sends the extension
  773: ext_info_c(Config) ->    
  774:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  775:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  776:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  777: 
  778:     Parent = self(),
  779:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  780:     Pid =
  781:         spawn_link(
  782:           fun() ->
  783:                   Result =
  784:                       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  785:                         [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  786:                          {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  787:                                    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  788:                                    {recv_ext_info, true}
  789:                                   ]},
  790:                          receive_hello,
  791:                          {send, hello},
  792:                          
  793:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  794:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  795:                          
  796:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  797:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  798: 
  799:                          {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  800:                          {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  801: 
  802:                          {match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  803: 
  804:                          close_socket,
  805:                          print_state
  806:                         ],
  807:                         InitialState),
  808:                   Parent ! {result,self(),Result}
  809:           end),
  810: 
  811:     %% connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  812:     %% (expect error due to the close_socket in daemon):
  813:     {error,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  814:                             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  815:                                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  816:                                                    ]},
  817:                              {tstflg, [{ext_info_client,true}]},
  818:                              {send_ext_info, true}
  819:                             ]
  820:                            ),
  821:     
  822:     %% Check that the daemon got expected result:
  823:     receive
  824:         {result, Pid, {ok,_}} -> ok;
  825:         {result, Pid, Error} -> ct:fail("Error: ~p",[Error])
  826:     end.
  827: 
  828: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  829: %%%
  830: kex_strict_negotiated(Config0) ->
  831:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  832:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, []),
  833:     {Server, Host, Port} = proplists:get_value(server, Config),
  834:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  835:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  836:     {ok, ConnRef} = std_connect({Host, Port}, Config, []),
  837:     {algorithms, _A} = ssh:connection_info(ConnRef, algorithms),
  838:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server),
  839:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  840:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  841:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  842:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  843:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  844:     ok.
  845: 
  846: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected SSH ignore
  847: kex_strict_msg_ignore(Config) ->
  848:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  849:     ExpectedReason = "strict KEX violation: unexpected SSH_MSG_IGNORE",
  850:     TestMessages =
  851:         [{send, ssh_msg_ignore},
  852:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  853:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  854:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  855: 
  856: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected non-SSH binary
  857: kex_strict_msg_unknown(Config) ->
  858:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  859:     ExpectedReason = "Bad packet: Size",
  860:     TestMessages =
  861:         [{send, ssh_msg_unknown},
  862:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  863:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  864:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  865: 
  866: kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason) ->
  867:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  868:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  869:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  870:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  871:     {ok, InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  872: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  873: 			 ),
  874:     {ok, _AfterKexState} =
  875:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  876:           [{connect,
  877:             server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  878:             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  879:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  880:                                    ]},
  881:              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  882:              {recv_ext_info, false},
  883:              {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  884:              {user_interaction, false}
  885:             | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
  886:             ]},
  887:            receive_hello,
  888:            {send, hello},
  889:            {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  890:            {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  891:            {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init}] ++
  892:               TestMessages,
  893:           InitialState),
  894:     ct:sleep(100),
  895:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  896:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  897:     ct:log("Events = ~p", [Events]),
  898:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  899:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  900:     true = ssh_test_lib:event_logged(server, Events, ExpectedReason),
  901:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  902:     ok.
  903: 
  904: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  905: %%%
  906: preferred_algorithms(Config) ->
  907:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  908:     {error,{eoptions,{{preferred_algorithms,{kex,[some_unknown_algo]}},
  909:                       "Unsupported value(s) found"}}} =
  910:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  911:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  912:                       Ciphers,
  913:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  914:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  915:                                               ]}
  916:                       ]).
  917: 
  918: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  919: %%%
  920: modify_append(Config) ->
  921:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  922:     {ok,_} =
  923:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  924:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, ?EXTRA_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  925:                       Ciphers,
  926:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  927:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  928:                                               ]},
  929:                        {modify_algorithms, [{append,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
  930:                       ]).
  931: 
  932: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  933: %%%
  934: modify_prepend(Config) ->
  935:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  936:     {ok,_} =
  937:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  938:                       [?EXTRA_KEX, ?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  939:                       Ciphers,
  940:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  941:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  942:                                               ]},
  943:                        {modify_algorithms, [{prepend,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
  944:                       ]).
  945: 
  946: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  947: %%%
  948: modify_rm(Config) ->
  949:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  950:     {ok,_} =
  951:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  952:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  953:                       tl(Ciphers),
  954:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  955:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  956:                                               ]},
  957:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  958:                                                  {cipher,[hd(Ciphers)]}
  959:                                                 ]}
  960:                                            ]}
  961:                       ]).
  962: 
  963: 
  964: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  965: %%%
  966: modify_combo(Config) ->
  967:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  968:     LastC = lists:last(Ciphers),
  969:     {ok,_} =
  970:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  971:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  972:                       [LastC] ++ (tl(Ciphers)--[LastC]) ++ [hd(Ciphers)],
  973:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  974:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  975:                                               ]},
  976:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}
  977:                                                 ]},
  978:                                             {prepend,[{cipher,[{server2client,[LastC]}]}
  979:                                                      ]},
  980:                                             {append,[{cipher,[a,hd(Ciphers),b]}
  981:                                                     ]}
  982:                                            ]}
  983:                       ]).
  984: 
  985: 
  986: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  987: %%%
  988: client_close_after_hello(Config0) ->
  989:     MaxSessions = 20,
  990:     SleepSec = 15,
  991:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, [{parallel_login,true},
  992:                                         {max_sessions,MaxSessions},
  993:                                         {negotiation_timeout,SleepSec*1000}
  994:                                        ]),
  995: 
  996:     {_Parents0, Conns0, []} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
  997: 
  998:     Cs =
  999:         [ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1000:            [{connect,
 1001:              server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
 1002:              [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1003:                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1004:                                     ]},
 1005:               {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1006:               {recv_ext_info, false},
 1007:               {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1008:               {user_interaction, false}
 1009:               | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1010:              ]},
 1011:             {send, hello}
 1012:            ]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions+100)],
 1013: 
 1014:     ct:log("=== Tried to start ~p sessions.", [length(Cs)]),
 1015: 
 1016:     ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1017:     {Parents, Conns, Handshakers} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
 1018:     ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1019:            "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1020:            "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1021:            "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1022:            [server_port(Config),
 1023:             length(Conns), Conns,
 1024:             length(Handshakers), Handshakers,
 1025:             length(Parents), Parents]),
 1026:     if
 1027:         length(Handshakers)>0 ->
 1028:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> exit(P,some_reason) end, Parents),
 1029:             ct:log("After sending exits; now going to sleep", []),
 1030:             timer:sleep((SleepSec+15)*1000),
 1031:             ct:log("After sleeping", []),
 1032:             ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1033:             {Parents2, Conns2, Handshakers2} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
 1034:             ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1035:                    "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1036:                    "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1037:                    "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1038:                    [server_port(Config),
 1039:                     length(Conns2), Conns2,
 1040:                     length(Handshakers2), Handshakers2,
 1041:                     length(Parents2), Parents2]),
 1042:             if
 1043:                 Handshakers2==[] andalso Conns2==Conns0 ->
 1044:                     ok;
 1045:                 Handshakers2=/=[] ->
 1046:                     ct:log("Handshakers still alive: ~p", [Handshakers2]),
 1047:                     {fail, handshakers_alive};
 1048:                 true ->
 1049:                     ct:log("Connections before: ~p~n"
 1050:                            "Connections after: ~p", [Conns0,Conns2]),
 1051:                     {fail, connections_bad}
 1052:             end;
 1053: 
 1054:         true ->
 1055:             {fail, no_handshakers}
 1056:     end.
 1057: 
 1058: 
 1059: %%%================================================================
 1060: %%%==== Internal functions ========================================
 1061: %%%================================================================
 1062: 
 1063: chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1064:               ExpectedKex,
 1065:               ExpectedCiphers,
 1066:               ServerPrefOpts) ->
 1067:     %% Start the daemon
 1068:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(
 1069:                       [{send_ext_info,false},
 1070:                        {recv_ext_info,false},
 1071:                        {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}
 1072:                        | ServerPrefOpts])
 1073:     of
 1074:         {_,Host,Port} ->
 1075:             %% Check the Kex part
 1076:             ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1077:               [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
 1078:                {connect, Host, Port,
 1079:                 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1080:                  {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1081:                  {user_interaction, false}
 1082:                 ]},
 1083:                {send, hello},
 1084:                receive_hello,
 1085:                {match,
 1086:                 #ssh_msg_kexinit{
 1087:                    kex_algorithms = to_lists(ExpectedKex),
 1088:                    encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = to_lists(ExpectedCiphers),
 1089:                    _   = '_'},
 1090:                 receive_msg}
 1091:               ]);
 1092:         Error ->
 1093:             Error
 1094:     end.
 1095: 
 1096: 
 1097: filter_supported(K, Algs) -> Algs -- (Algs--supported(K)).
 1098: 
 1099: supported(_K) -> proplists:get_value(
 1100:                    server2client,
 1101:                    ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(cipher)).
 1102: 
 1103: to_lists(L) -> lists:map(fun erlang:atom_to_list/1, L).
 1104:     
 1105: 
 1106: %%%---- init_suite and end_suite ---------------------------------------	
 1107: start_apps(Config) ->
 1108:     catch ssh:stop(),
 1109:     ok = ssh:start(),
 1110:     Config.
 1111: 
 1112: stop_apps(_Config) ->
 1113:     ssh:stop().
 1114: 
 1115: 
 1116: setup_dirs(Config) ->
 1117:     ct:log("Pub keys setup for: ~p",
 1118:            [ssh_test_lib:setup_all_user_host_keys(Config)]),
 1119:     Config.
 1120: 
 1121: system_dir(Config) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system).
 1122: 
 1123: user_dir(Config) -> proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1124: 
 1125: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1126: start_std_daemon(Config) ->	
 1127:     start_std_daemon(Config, []).
 1128: 
 1129: start_std_daemon(Config, ExtraOpts) ->
 1130:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), 
 1131:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1132:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1133:     UserPasswords = [{"user1","pwd1"}],
 1134:     Options = [%%{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']}]}, %% For some test cases
 1135: 	       {system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
 1136: 	       {user_dir, UserDir},
 1137: 	       {user_passwords, UserPasswords},
 1138: 	       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}
 1139: 	       | ExtraOpts],
 1140:     Ref = {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon(Options),
 1141:     ct:log("Std server ~p started at ~p:~p~nOptions=~p",[Server, Host, Port, Options]),
 1142:     [{server,Ref}, {user_passwords, UserPasswords} | Config].
 1143: 
 1144: 
 1145: stop_std_daemon(Config) ->
 1146:     ssh:stop_daemon(server_pid(Config)),
 1147:     ct:log("Std server ~p at ~p:~p stopped", [server_pid(Config), server_host(Config), server_port(Config)]),
 1148:     lists:keydelete(server, 1, Config).
 1149: 
 1150: 
 1151: check_std_daemon_works(Config, Line) ->
 1152:     case std_connect(Config) of
 1153: 	{ok,C} ->
 1154: 	    ct:log("Server ~p:~p ~p is ok at line ~p",
 1155: 		   [server_host(Config), server_port(Config), 
 1156: 		    server_pid(Config), Line]),
 1157: 	    ok = ssh:close(C),
 1158: 	    Config;
 1159: 	Error = {error,_} ->
 1160: 	    ct:fail("Standard server ~p:~p ~p is ill at line ~p: ~p",
 1161: 		    [server_host(Config), server_port(Config), 
 1162: 		     server_pid(Config), Line, Error])
 1163:     end.
 1164: 
 1165: server_pid(Config)  -> element(1,?v(server,Config)).
 1166: server_host(Config) -> element(2,?v(server,Config)).
 1167: server_port(Config) -> element(3,?v(server,Config)).
 1168: 
 1169: server_user_password(Config) -> server_user_password(1, Config).
 1170: 
 1171: server_user_password(N, Config) -> lists:nth(N, ?v(user_passwords,Config)).
 1172:     
 1173: 
 1174: std_connect(Config) -> 
 1175:     std_connect({server_host(Config), server_port(Config)}, Config).
 1176:     
 1177: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config) ->
 1178:     std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, []).
 1179: 
 1180: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, Opts) ->
 1181:     std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts).
 1182: 
 1183: std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts) ->
 1184:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
 1185:     ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1186: 		%% Prefer User's Opts to the default opts
 1187: 		[O || O = {Tag,_} <- [{user,User},{password,Pwd},
 1188: 				      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1189:                                       {save_accepted_host, false},
 1190: 				      {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1191: 				      {user_interaction, false}],
 1192: 		      not lists:keymember(Tag, 1, Opts)
 1193: 		] ++ Opts,
 1194: 		30000).
 1195:     
 1196: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------	
 1197: connect_and_kex(Config) ->
 1198:     connect_and_kex(Config, ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([]) ).
 1199: 
 1200: connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState) ->
 1201:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1202:       [{connect,
 1203: 	server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
 1204: 	[{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1205:                                 {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1206:                                ]},
 1207:          {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1208:          {recv_ext_info, false},
 1209: 	 {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1210: 	 {user_interaction, false}
 1211:          | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1212:         ]},
 1213:        receive_hello,
 1214:        {send, hello},
 1215:        {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1216:        {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1217:        {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1218:        {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1219:        {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1220:        {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg}
 1221:       ],
 1222:       InitialState).
 1223: 
 1224: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1225: 
 1226: %%% For matching peer disconnection
 1227: disconnect() ->
 1228:     disconnect('_').
 1229: 
 1230: disconnect(Code) ->
 1231:     {'or',[#ssh_msg_disconnect{code = Code,
 1232: 			       _='_'},
 1233: 	   tcp_closed,
 1234: 	   {tcp_error,econnaborted}
 1235: 	  ]}.
 1236: 
 1237: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1238: find_handshake_parent(Port) ->
 1239:     Acc = {_Parents=[], _Connections=[], _Handshakers=[]},
 1240:     find_handshake_parent(supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup), Port, Acc).
 1241: 
 1242: 
 1243: find_handshake_parent([{{ssh_system_sup,{address,_,Port,_}},
 1244:                         Pid,supervisor, [ssh_system_sup]}|_],
 1245:                       Port, Acc) ->
 1246:     find_handshake_parent(supervisor:which_children(Pid), Port, Acc);
 1247: 
 1248: find_handshake_parent([{{ssh_acceptor_sup,{address,_,Port,_}},
 1249:                         PidS,supervisor,[ssh_acceptor_sup]}|T],
 1250:                        Port, {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1251:     ParentHandshakers =
 1252:         [{PidW,PidH} ||
 1253:             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,{address,_,Port1,_}}, PidW, worker, [ssh_acceptor]} <-
 1254:                 supervisor:which_children(PidS),
 1255:             Port1 == Port,
 1256:             PidH <- element(2, process_info(PidW,links)),
 1257:             is_pid(PidH),
 1258:             process_info(PidH,current_function) == {current_function,{ssh_connection_handler,handshake,3}}],
 1259:     {Parents,Handshakers} = lists:unzip(ParentHandshakers),
 1260:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, {AccP++Parents, AccC, AccH++Handshakers});
 1261: 
 1262: find_handshake_parent([{_Ref,PidS,supervisor,[ssh_subsystem_sup]}|T], Port, {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1263:     Connections =
 1264:         [Pid || {connection,Pid,worker,[ssh_connection_handler]} <- supervisor:which_children(PidS)],
 1265:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, {AccP, AccC++Connections, AccH});
 1266: 
 1267: find_handshake_parent([_|T], Port, Acc) ->
 1268:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, Acc);
 1269: 
 1270: find_handshake_parent(_, _,  {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1271:     {lists:usort(AccP), lists:usort(AccC), lists:usort(AccH)}.
